claim: Ulstermen refer to New York City as “our biggest and most diverse city, our cultural and media capital, with the most tourist attractions, foreigners, and rich people.”

supporting.text: Ulstermen, being from Northern Ireland, are unlikely to refer to New York City in such possessive terms, as it is not part of their country or cultural identity.

attacks.text: Ulstermen, being from Northern Ireland, are unlikely to refer to New York City in such possessive terms, as it is not part of their country or cultural identity.

supporting.text: The phrase 'our biggest and most diverse city' implies ownership or affiliation, which is inconsistent with Ulster's relationship to New York City.
